The Center would maintain a tape library for loan of specialized programs, although

Finally, the Center would make its Washington production facility available to
other groups in the Washington area with interests related to those of the Center,
and would offer to do administrative distribution for those groups, subject only to
the reasonable demands that the first priority in yse of those facilities is for
Center-directed work.
(Various educational associations and groups such as the Urban Coalition are seen
in this situation.) ~ }
